sponsoredLegislation.title: Concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that during the Nation's present economic crisis, and so long as the national unemployment rate remains at 6 percent or more, the emergency unemployment program established by the Emergency Jobs and Unemployment Assistance Act of 1974 should be extended to continue benefits for involuntarily unemployed individuals when 25-percent or more of workers entitled to compensation thereunder are unable to find jobs during the period for which they are eligible for benefits.
